title.zh_CN: Words of Wisdom delivered at The Temple Of Ultimate Bliss of Tainan Taiwan—Communities thrive when people praise one another, but they decline when people suspect one another
title.zh_TW: Words of Wisdom delivered at The Temple Of Ultimate Bliss of Tainan Taiwan—Communities thrive when people praise one another, but they decline when people suspect one another

paragraphs.zh_CN: No one believes in what religions can offer.
paragraphs.zh_TW: No one believes in what religions can offer.

paragraphs.zh_CN: In the future quantum theory will greatly help the unity of religions: "All gods are one entity, all religions are one family."
paragraphs.zh_TW: In the future quantum theory will greatly help the unity of religions: "All gods are one entity, all religions are one family."

paragraphs.zh_CN: Quantum theory will prove this scientifically.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Quantum theory will prove this scientifically.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Your pure mind attained is the Buddha's mind, which is omnipotent and all-knowing.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Your pure mind attained is the Buddha's mind, which is omnipotent and all-knowing.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Why?
paragraphs.zh_TW: Why?

paragraphs.zh_CN: Because everything comes from your mind.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Because everything comes from your mind.

paragraphs.zh_CN: If you use your pure mind, then you will know everything.
paragraphs.zh_TW: If you use your pure mind, then you will know everything.

paragraphs.zh_CN: This is not strange at all.
paragraphs.zh_TW: This is not strange at all.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Everyone is capable of being supernatural because it is instinct.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Everyone is capable of being supernatural because it is instinct.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Where has your supernatural power gone?
paragraphs.zh_TW: Where has your supernatural power gone?

paragraphs.zh_CN: It got lost.
paragraphs.zh_TW: It got lost.

paragraphs.zh_CN: You lost it the moment you started thinking.
paragraphs.zh_TW: You lost it the moment you started thinking.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Observing precepts helps meditation.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Observing precepts helps meditation.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Meditation brings on wisdom.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Meditation brings on wisdom.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Wisdom is instinct.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Wisdom is instinct.

paragraphs.zh_CN: That is how not thinking leads to wisdom.
paragraphs.zh_TW: That is how not thinking leads to wisdom.

paragraphs.zh_CN: That is how we get to know everything, just as the Buddhas and the Bodhisattvas do.
paragraphs.zh_TW: That is how we get to know everything, just as the Buddhas and the Bodhisattvas do.

paragraphs.zh_CN: They know because they are not lost.
paragraphs.zh_TW: They know because they are not lost.

paragraphs.zh_CN: We don't know because we are lost.
paragraphs.zh_TW: We don't know because we are lost.

paragraphs.zh_CN: What is getting lost?
paragraphs.zh_TW: What is getting lost?

paragraphs.zh_CN: Thinking is getting lost.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Thinking is getting lost.

paragraphs.zh_CN: When we see fruits on the table, it is awareness that enables us to see them.
paragraphs.zh_TW: When we see fruits on the table, it is awareness that enables us to see them.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Once we start thinking about wanting to eat them, we are lost.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Once we start thinking about wanting to eat them, we are lost.

paragraphs.zh_CN: It takes great skills to eat them without thinking about them.
paragraphs.zh_TW: It takes great skills to eat them without thinking about them.

paragraphs.zh_CN: So by practising meditation, wisdom will come naturally.
paragraphs.zh_TW: So by practising meditation, wisdom will come naturally.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Orientals emphasise mental tranquility, that state of the mind is the "pure mind".
paragraphs.zh_TW: Orientals emphasise mental tranquility, that state of the mind is the "pure mind".

paragraphs.zh_CN: This is the core of learning.
paragraphs.zh_TW: This is the core of learning.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Once your mind is stirred, you are lost.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Once your mind is stirred, you are lost.

paragraphs.zh_CN: When it comes to the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body and mind reacting to sight, sound, smell, taste, touch and idea, the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas are different from us.
paragraphs.zh_TW: When it comes to the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body and mind reacting to sight, sound, smell, taste, touch and idea, the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas are different from us.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Their mind is in a quiet state and they do not think even when they use their eyes to see and their ears to hear.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Their mind is in a quiet state and they do not think even when they use their eyes to see and their ears to hear.

paragraphs.zh_CN: When the eyes achieve samadhi on seeing and the ears achieve samadhi on hearing, the pure mind will appear.
paragraphs.zh_TW: When the eyes achieve samadhi on seeing and the ears achieve samadhi on hearing, the pure mind will appear.

paragraphs.zh_CN: The Buddhas and the Bodhisattvas can do it, so can each of us.
paragraphs.zh_TW: The Buddhas and the Bodhisattvas can do it, so can each of us.

paragraphs.zh_CN: So everything originates from the same entity.
paragraphs.zh_TW: So everything originates from the same entity.

paragraphs.zh_CN: The whole universe and each of us are one entity.
paragraphs.zh_TW: The whole universe and each of us are one entity.

paragraphs.zh_CN: To practise Buddhism is to return to the same entity.
paragraphs.zh_TW: To practise Buddhism is to return to the same entity.

paragraphs.zh_CN: To return to the same entity offers us the ultimate freedom from our being.
paragraphs.zh_TW: To return to the same entity offers us the ultimate freedom from our being.

paragraphs.zh_CN: How to tell whether it is true or false?
paragraphs.zh_TW: How to tell whether it is true or false?

paragraphs.zh_CN: As quantum theory puts it, everything from a mind stirred is false.
paragraphs.zh_TW: As quantum theory puts it, everything from a mind stirred is false.

paragraphs.zh_CN: With the whole universe in front of me, it is false once my mind is stirred and I start thinking.
paragraphs.zh_TW: With the whole universe in front of me, it is false once my mind is stirred and I start thinking.

paragraphs.zh_CN: It is true once I keep my mind in a quiet state and do not think.
paragraphs.zh_TW: It is true once I keep my mind in a quiet state and do not think.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Trueness and falseness is the same.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Trueness and falseness is the same.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Trueness is falseness, and falseness is trueness.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Trueness is falseness, and falseness is trueness.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Why?
paragraphs.zh_TW: Why?

paragraphs.zh_CN: Because trueness does not entail birth and death, but falseness entails birth and death.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Because trueness does not entail birth and death, but falseness entails birth and death.

paragraphs.zh_CN: That is why there is birth and death once you stir your mind and start thinking, but there is neither birth nor death once you keep your mind in a quiet state and do not think.
paragraphs.zh_TW: That is why there is birth and death once you stir your mind and start thinking, but there is neither birth nor death once you keep your mind in a quiet state and do not think.

paragraphs.zh_CN: This is fascinating.
paragraphs.zh_TW: This is fascinating.

paragraphs.zh_CN: What is so good about the Diamonds Sutra?
paragraphs.zh_TW: What is so good about the Diamonds Sutra?

paragraphs.zh_CN: It is simple and clear, nothing verbose.
paragraphs.zh_TW: It is simple and clear, nothing verbose.

paragraphs.zh_CN: It tells the truth that "everything with form is unreal".
paragraphs.zh_TW: It tells the truth that "everything with form is unreal".

paragraphs.zh_CN: Once you truly let go, you will become a Bodhisattva and set an example for others.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Once you truly let go, you will become a Bodhisattva and set an example for others.

paragraphs.zh_CN: The Chinese cleverly live up to that example through the Confucian practice of composure, kindness, courtesy, moderation and modesty.
paragraphs.zh_TW: The Chinese cleverly live up to that example through the Confucian practice of composure, kindness, courtesy, moderation and modesty.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Wherever a Confucius follower may be, you can see that he does not scramble to win; he is modest, he steps back.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Wherever a Confucius follower may be, you can see that he does not scramble to win; he is modest, he steps back.

paragraphs.zh_CN: The first and the last is actually the same.
paragraphs.zh_TW: The first and the last is actually the same.

paragraphs.zh_CN: The one stepping back is wiser than the one advancing.
paragraphs.zh_TW: The one stepping back is wiser than the one advancing.

paragraphs.zh_CN: The one who has stepped back had a pure mind.
paragraphs.zh_TW: The one who has stepped back had a pure mind.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Without a pure mind he would not be able to take that step backwards.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Without a pure mind he would not be able to take that step backwards.

paragraphs.zh_CN: If he were pretending, he would have failed in doing that.
paragraphs.zh_TW: If he were pretending, he would have failed in doing that.

paragraphs.zh_CN: A pure mind leads to the realm of the saints.
paragraphs.zh_TW: A pure mind leads to the realm of the saints.

paragraphs.zh_CN: That is why the Chinese traditional way of life is unique in the world.
paragraphs.zh_TW: That is why the Chinese traditional way of life is unique in the world.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Inwardly, there is no greed, hatred, delusion, arrogance and suspicion, it is the realm of the Buddha.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Inwardly, there is no greed, hatred, delusion, arrogance and suspicion, it is the realm of the Buddha.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Outwardly, there is composure, kindness, courtesy, moderation and modesty, it is the realm of Confucianism.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Outwardly, there is composure, kindness, courtesy, moderation and modesty, it is the realm of Confucianism.

paragraphs.zh_CN: The interior and the exterior of a person is the same thing.
paragraphs.zh_TW: The interior and the exterior of a person is the same thing.

paragraphs.zh_CN: They are two sides of the same coin.
paragraphs.zh_TW: They are two sides of the same coin.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Both Confucianism and Buddhism have achieved it, but not the others.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Both Confucianism and Buddhism have achieved it, but not the others.

paragraphs.zh_CN: If Confucius were born in India, the Indian would have called him a Buddha.
paragraphs.zh_TW: If Confucius were born in India, the Indian would have called him a Buddha.

paragraphs.zh_CN: If Buddha Shakyamuni were born in China, the Chinese would have called him a saint.
paragraphs.zh_TW: If Buddha Shakyamuni were born in China, the Chinese would have called him a saint.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Let us eat this together.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Let us eat this together.

paragraphs.zh_CN: Eating without stirring the mind, without a thought.
paragraphs.zh_TW: Eating without stirring the mind, without a thought.

paragraphs.zh_CN: This is how we should practise Buddhism.
paragraphs.zh_TW: This is how we should practise Buddhism.

paragraphs.zh_CN: If people praise one another, the communities will thrive.
paragraphs.zh_TW: If people praise one another, the communities will thrive.
